Title: N. Korea sent 100 ballistic missiles, military specialists to Rus...
Description: North Korea has supplied more than 100 KN-23 and KN-24 ballistic missiles, and dispatched military specialists to Russia in support of its war with Ukraine, a Ukrainian defense intelligence unit has said.

Title: Israel to decide on ceasefire as US says deal 'close'
Description: Israel's security cabinet was preparing to decide whether to accept a proposed cease-fire in its war with Hezbollah, an official said Monday, as the White House announced it believed a deal to end the fighting in Lebanon was near.

Title: Judge tosses Trump 2020 election case after prosecutors' request
Description: A U.S. judge on Monday dismissed the federal criminal case accusing Donald Trump of attempting to overturn his 2020 election defeat after prosecutors moved to drop that prosecution and a second case against the president-elect, citing Justice Department policy against prosecuting a sitting president.

Title: Trump promises 25% tariff on Mexico and Canada, extra 10% tariff ...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Monday pledged a 25 percent tariff on all products from Mexico and Canada from his first day in office, and an additional 10 percent tariff on goods from China, citing illegal immigration and the trade of illicit drugs.

Title: N. Korea cuts power lines supplying electricity to shuttered Kaes...
Description: North Korea has cut power lines installed by South Korea to supply electricity to a now-shuttered joint industrial park in the North Korean border city of Kaesong, South Korea's military said, the latest in Pyongyang's move to sever inter-Korean ties.

Title: NK leader calls for regions' efforts for independent development
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has visited an offshore fishing farm under construction in the eastern port city of Sinpho, calling for regions to use their own natural and economic resources in a bid to develop themselves independently, state media reported Tuesday.

Title: German Social Democrats nominate Scholz to run again for chancell...
Description: The executive committee of Germany's centre-left Social Democratic Party (SPD) nominated Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday as the party's top candidate in upcoming early elections, following a tough and controversial internal debate.

Title: Have China's plans for nuclear-powered aircraft carrier taken ano...
Description: Reports that China has built a prototype nuclear reactor for its next aircraft carrier have prompted renewed focus on its supposed long-term ambition to project naval power far from its shores.

Title: Pakistan strikes 7-day cease-fire deal between warring sectarian ...
Description: A Pakistani government team mediated a seven-day cease-fire deal between rival sectarian groups on Sunday, halting days of clashes that have killed at least 68 people and injured dozens in the northwest of the country, one of the mediators said.

Title: NK troops disguised as 'indigenous' people in Far East for combat...
Description: A group of North Korean soldiers disguised as 'indigenous people' of Russia's Far East have engaged in combat with Ukrainian troops in Russia's western border region of Kursk, according to a Ukraine news report.

Title: Key Trump pick calls for end to escalation in Ukraine
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's top security advisor called on Sunday for an end to the escalation of the war between Ukraine and Russia, and for both parties to come to the negotiating table.

Title: N. Korea, Russia sign agreement to enhance sports exchanges: KCNA
Description: North Korea and Russia have signed a protocol on enhancing sports exchanges for next year, the North's state media said Monday, as the two nations have been bolstering cooperation in various fields.

Title: Top security adviser sees high possibility of N. Korea's launch o...
Description: South Korea's top security adviser said Sunday he saw a high possibility that North Korea is likely to launch another spy satellite before the end of this year, though signs of an imminent launch have yet to be detected.

Title: Putin signs law letting Ukraine fighters write off bad debts
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Saturday signed a law that allows those who sign up to fight in Ukraine to write off unpaid debts worth almost $100,000, the government announced.

Title: Ukrainian media reports 500 N. Korean soldiers killed in Kyiv's m...
Description: A Ukrainian media outlet has reported that about 500 North Korean soldiers were killed in a missile strike by Kyiv in Russia's western Kursk region.

Title: Why young Hongkongers become police officers after 2019 social un...
Description: The 2019 social unrest in Hong Kong may have soured relations between the public and police, but for Jeff Wong Lok-ching, it prompted him to join the force despite his family expressing concerns and friends cutting ties.

Title: Trump taps key Project 2025 architect Russ Vought to head budget ...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump has chosen Russ Vought, a key architect of 'Project 2025,' the controversial conservative plan to overhaul the government, to be director of the U.S. Office of Management and Budget, a powerful agency that helps decide the president's policy priorities and how to pay for them.

Title: Will Kim Jong-un visit Moscow next year?
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un may visit Russia early next year, analysts suggest, as the ongoing conflict in Ukraine has solidified the 'blood alliance' between the two nations.

Title: NATO head and Trump meet in Florida for talks on global security
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump and the head of NATO have met for talks on global security, the military alliance said Saturday.

Title: US assesses N. Korea is prepared for 7th nuke test, awaits 'only ...
Description: The United States believes that North Korea is prepared for a possible seventh nuclear test while awaiting 'only a political decision' to go ahead, a senior U.S. official said Friday, warning another nuclear experiment would mark a 'grave' escalation of regional tensions.

Title: Trump picks ex-N. Korea policy official as his principal deputy n...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump named Alex Wong, who was engaged in working-level nuclear talks with North Korea during his first term, as his principal deputy national security adviser amid expectations he could seek to reengage with Pyongyang after returning to office.

Title: Trump taps hedge fund mogul Scott Bessent as treasury secretary
Description: President-elect Donald Trump officially nominated Scott Bessent as his treasury secretary Friday, describing the hedge fund mogul as a 'strong' advocate of his America First agenda and vowing to usher in a 'new golden age' for the United States.

Title: Bitcoin at record highs, sets sights on $100,000
Description: Bitcoin touched a fresh record high on Friday, with its sights set firmly on the $100,000 barrier, in a stellar rally for the cryptocurrency sparked by expectations of a more friendly regulatory environment under a Donald Trump administration.

Title: Texas is taking a final vote on allowing Bible-infused lessons in...
Description: Texas would allow Bible-infused lessons in elementary schools under changes that were set for a final vote Friday and could test boundaries between religion and public education in the U.S.

Title: Japan passes $250 bil. economic package meant to lift wages and s...
Description: Japan approved a 39 trillion yen ($250 billion) economic stimulus package Friday centered around initiatives it said were aimed at boosting individual incomes.

Title: 6 tourists dead in Laos after apparently drinking methanol
Description: Two Australian teenagers and a British woman died from suspected methanol poisoning after drinking tainted alcohol in Laos. An American man and two Danes also died, though their exact causes of death have not been released. A New Zealander also has been sickened. The U.S. State Department issued a warning to travelers to be 'alert to the potential risk of methanol poisoning.' But what is methanol, and how do you avoid it?

Title: Texas governor orders state agencies to sell China assets
Description: The governor of Texas ordered state agencies to stop investing in China and sell assets there as soon as possible, citing financial and security risks, a sign of rising U.S.-China tensions starting to impact global capital flows.

Title: Could US-NK talks resume under Trump 2.0?
Description: A North Korea expert stated on Friday that the prospect of U.S.-North Korea dialogue during Donald Trump’s second presidency might be closer than ever, despite negative remarks from North Korean leader Kim Jong-un regarding his previous talks with Trump.

Title: Russia's missile 'warning' to Ukraine and West: what we know
Description: Russia on Thursday fired an experimental missile at Ukraine in a clear warning of its capabilities, officials from Western governments said, even as they pushed back against Ukrainian claims of a more provocative action by Moscow.

Title: Sweden's Northvolt files for bankruptcy, in blow to Europe's EV a...
Description: Northvolt, the Swedish maker of battery cells for electric vehicles, said on Thursday it has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in the U.S., dealing a blow to Europe's hopes that its most developed battery player would reduce Western car makers' reliance on Chinese rivals.

Title: Putin gifts zoo animals, including lion and bears, to North Korea...
Description: Russia transferred more than 70 animals, including an African lion and two brown bears, to a zoo in the North Korean capital Pyongyang from Moscow's zoo, the Russian government said on Wednesday.

Title: N. Korea denounces new UN human rights resolution as 'political p...
Description: North Korea on Friday denounced a resolution recently adopted by a United Nations committee regarding the country's human rights violations as a 'politically motivated provocation.'

Title: Trump picks Pam Bondi for US Attorney General after Gaetz withdra...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Thursday nominated former Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi to be Attorney General of the United States, moving swiftly to replace former nominee Matt Gaetz after the embattled former congressman withdrew from consideration.

Title: NK leader says past negotiations with US only confirmed hostile p...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has said that his country went to every length in negotiations with the United States, but it only confirmed Washington's unwavering hostile policy toward Pyongyang, the North's state media said Friday.

Title: Senior NK general wounded in Ukraine strike in Russia: WSJ
Description: A senior North Korean general was wounded in a Ukrainian strike in Russia's western Kursk region, the Wall Street Journal has reported, citing Western officials.

Title: Russia fired experimental ballistic missile at Ukraine: Putin
Description: Russia fired a hypersonic intermediate-range ballistic missile at the city of Dnipro on Thursday in response to the U.S. and U.K. allowing Kyiv to strike Russian territory with advanced Western weapons, in a further escalation of the 33-month-old war.

Title: ICC issues arrest warrants for Netanyahu, Hamas officials
Description: The International Criminal Court issued arrest warrants on Thursday for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, his former defense minister and Hamas officials, accusing them of war crimes and crimes against humanity over the war in Gaza and the October 2023 attacks that triggered Israel’s offensive in the Palestinian territory.

Title: At UN climate talks, nations blast draft of vague deal on climate...
Description: Countries of the world took turns rejecting a new but vague draft text released early Thursday which attempts to form the spine of any deal reached at United Nations climate talks on money for developing countries to transition to clean energy and adapt to climate change.

Title: Vice defense minister condemns N. Korean troop deployment in ASEA...
Description: Vice Defense Minister Kim Seon-ho condemned on Thursday North Korea's deployment of troops in support of Russia in its war with Ukraine, expressing concerns that the North will likely use the technology and funds it receives in return to advance its nuclear and missile weapons.

Title: US regulators seek to break up Google, forcing Chrome sale as par...
Description: U.S. regulators want a federal judge to break up Google to prevent the company from continuing to squash competition through its dominant search engine after a court found it had maintained an abusive monopoly over the past decade.

Title: Russia launches long-range missile in morning attack on Ukraine: ...
Description: Russia launched an intercontinental ballistic missile from its southern Astrakhan region during a morning attack on Ukraine on Thursday, Kyiv's air force said, the first time Russia has used such a powerful, long-range missile during the war.

Title: [INTERVIEW] Trump election win will affirm Yoon’s reluctance to a...
Description: South Korea faces a difficult choice between providing weapons directly to Ukraine and remaining ambivalent about it until U.S. President-elect Donald Trump takes office in January, while North Korean troops are being deployed to the Ukrainian front.

Title: Archegos' Bill Hwang sentenced to 18 years in prison for massive ...
Description: Former billionaire investor Sung Kook 'Bill' Hwang was sentenced to 18 years in prison on Wednesday over the collapse of Archegos Capital Management, which cost Wall Street banks more than $10 billion.

Title: S. Korea confirms N. Korea stole $42 mil. worth of cryptocurrency...
Description: South Korea confirmed Thursday that North Korean hackers were behind the theft of 58 billion won ($41.5 million) worth of cryptocurrency in 2019.

Title: Deadly storm pounds Northwest US, leaving half a million without ...
Description: A powerful storm clobbered Washington state on Wednesday, knocking out power to hundreds of thousands of people while disrupting road travel and causing at least two deaths and two injuries.

Title: Nvidia crushes earnings expectations on AI chip demand
Description: U.S. chip making behemoth Nvidia said Wednesday it made a $19 billion profit on record high revenue last quarter as demand continued for its hardware to power artificial intelligence.

Title: US to give antipersonnel mines to Ukraine to help slow Russian ad...
Description: The Biden administration announced Wednesday that it will give Ukraine antipersonnel mines to help it slow Russia’s battlefield advances, marking the second major shift on U.S. military support for Kyiv in days.

Title: N. Korea, Russia sign protocol on expanding economic cooperation
Description: North Korea and Russia have signed a protocol on expanding cooperation following their committee meeting on economy, science and technology in Pyongyang, the North's state media reported Thursday.

Title: US House passes N. Korean human rights reauthorization act
Description: The U.S. House of Representatives passed a bipartisan bill Wednesday to reauthorize and update the 2004 North Korean Human Rights Act aimed at promoting rights and freedom in the reclusive state.

Title: UN committee adopts resolution on N. Korean human rights for 20th...
Description: A U.N. General Assembly committee on Wednesday passed a resolution on North Korean human rights for the 20th consecutive year, calling for the U.N. system as a whole to continue to address the North's 'grave' situation 'in a coordinated and unified manner.'

Title: Ukraine reportedly fires UK Storm Shadow missiles into Russia
Description: Ukraine has fired U.K.-supplied Storm Shadow missiles into Russia for the first time, British media reported Wednesday, after being given the green light from London.

Title: Higher energy bills push UK inflation to 6-month high in October
Description: Inflation in the U.K. rose sharply to a six-month high in October and back above the rate targeted by rate-setters at the Bank of England, official figures showed Wednesday, cementing market expectations that there will be no further cuts in borrowing costs this year.

Title: US shuts Kyiv embassy due to 'potential significant air attack'
Kremlin spokesman rules out freezing Ukraine conflict
Description: Moscow on Wednesday rejected speculation about a potential freezing of the war in Ukraine.

Title: S. Korean spy agency monitoring possible Russia visit by N. Korea...
Description: South Korea’s spy agency said, Wednesday, that it is closely monitoring the possibility of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un visiting Russia.

Title: Trump, Musk watch SpaceX launch Starship, booster misses landing
Description: Elon Musk's SpaceX launched its giant Starship rocket to space from Texas on Tuesday, advancing the ship's spaceflight abilities but botching an attempt to bring its booster back to land as U.S. President-elect Donald Trump watched from the company's rocket facilities.

Title: UN calls China's 2023 repatriation of NK defectors 'arbitrary,' u...
Description: A United Nations working group has concluded that China's repatriation of North Korean defectors last year constitutes an 'arbitrary deprivation of liberty' and urged China and North Korea to take steps to address the issue, a document showed Wednesday.

Title: S. Korean spy agency confirms N. Korea's additional exports of ho...
Description: South Korea's spy agency confirmed Wednesday North Korea's additional exports of howitzers and multiple rocket launchers to Russia.

Title: Ukraine hits Russia with US ATACMS missiles for first time on war...
Description: Ukraine used U.S. ATACMS missiles to strike Russian territory on Tuesday, taking advantage of newly granted permission from the outgoing administration of U.S. President Joe Biden on the war's 1,000th day.

Title: N. Korea's Kim inspects regional factory construction site, urges...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has inspected industrial factories under construction and urged their successful completion in 20 regions as planned, the North's state media reported Wednesday.

Title: N. Korea, Russia discuss issues of mutual cooperation at committe...
Description: North Korea has held the 11th meeting of the intergovernmental committee on economic cooperation with Russia and discussed a range of issues on mutual cooperation, the North's state media reported Wednesday.

Title: US has not yet seen N. Korea's atmospheric reentry missile capabi...
Description: The commander of U.S. Indo-Pacific Command said Tuesday that the United States has 'not yet' seen North Korea's atmospheric reentry capability, a key technology required for the recalcitrant regime to advance its intercontinental ballistic missile (ICBM) program.

Title: Trump taps Cantor Fitzgerald CEO Lutnick as his commerce secretar...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday nominated Cantor Fitzgerald CEO Howard Lutnick as his commerce secretary, saying that if confirmed, Lutnick will spearhead the tariff and trade agenda of the incoming administration.

Title: Russia says Ukraine fired US long-range missiles at border milita...
Description: Russia's military said Tuesday that Ukraine fired U.S.-supplied long-range missiles at a military facility in the Bryansk border region, state media reported, in what would be the first attack since Washington authorized such strikes.

Title: Indian news agency ANI sues OpenAI for unsanctioned content use i...
Description: Indian news agency ANI has sued OpenAI in a New Delhi court, accusing the ChatGPT creator of using its published content without permission to help train the artificial intelligence chatbot, something that OpenAI says it has stopped doing.

Title: More than 200 children killed in Lebanon in past two months, UNIC...
Description: More than 200 children have been killed and 1,100 injured in Lebanon in the past two months, the U.N. children's agency (UNICEF) said on Tuesday.

Title: 7-Eleven founding family aims to raise $52 bil. for buyout this y...
Description: The founding Ito family behind Japanese retailer Seven & i aims to raise more than 8 trillion yen ($52 billion) to take it private by the end of this financial year, Japanese public broadcaster NHK reported on Tuesday.

Title: Putin issues warning to US with new nuclear doctrine
Description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday approved an updated nuclear doctrine, saying that Russia could consider using nuclear weapons if it was subject to a conventional missile assault on it supported by a nuclear power.

Title: Benny Tai jailed for 10 years over mastermind role in 'primary' e...
Description: Former legal academic Benny Tai Yiu-ting has been jailed for 10 years for conspiring to subvert state power after he initiated an unofficial legislative 'primary' election in the hope of bringing down the Hong Kong government four years ago.

Title: Rights activists tell NK soldiers fighting Ukraine to 'stand on t...
Description: Human rights activists released an open letter, Tuesday, calling for North Korean troops in Russia to stop helping the Kremlin’s 'unjustifiable' war efforts against Ukraine amid reports that some of them have already been killed.

Title: Russia, Chinese foreign ministers discuss ties, Ukraine, Korean P...
Description: Chinese and Russian foreign ministers discussed bilateral ties, the conflict in Ukraine and the situation on the Korean Peninsula on the sidelines of the Group of 20 meeting in Brazil, the foreign ministries of both countries said on Tuesday.

Title: 42,000 crowd New Zealand's Parliament grounds in support of M?ori...
Description: As tens of thousands of marchers crowded the streets in New Zealand’s capital Wellington on Tuesday, the throng of people, flags aloft, had the air of a festival or a parade rather than a protest. They arrived to oppose a law that would reshape the county’s founding treaty between Indigenous M?ori and the British Crown. But for many, it was about something more: a celebration of a resurging Indigenous language and identity that colonization had once almost destroyed.

Title: Moscow warns US over allowing Ukraine to hit Russian soil with lo...
Description: The Kremlin warned Monday that President Joe Biden’s decision to let Ukraine strike targets inside Russia with U.S. - supplied longer - range missiles adds 'fuel to the fire' of the war and would escalate international tensions even higher.

Title: Ukraine, marking 1,000 days of Russian invasion, eyes end to war ...
Description: Ukraine marked 1,000 days on Tuesday since Russia's full-scale invasion, with weary troops battling on numerous fronts, Kyiv besieged by frequent drone and missile strikes, and officials preparing for Donald Trump to reclaim the White House in January.

Title: N. Korea's Kim urges extensive promotion of relations with Russia...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has met with Russia's visiting natural resources minister and called for 'more extensive and diversified' promotion of cooperative relations between their countries, state media reported Tuesday.

Title: N. Korea's Kim urges extensive promotion of relations with Russia...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has met with Russia's visiting natural resources minister and called for 'more extensive and diversified' promotion of cooperative relations between their countries, state media reported Tuesday.

Title: Sweden, Finland urge residents to be ready for war
Description: Sweden on Monday began sending some five million pamphlets to residents urging them to prepare for the possibility of war, as neighbouring Finland launched a new preparedness website.

Title: India's capital shuts schools as 'death trap' smog chokes city
Description: India's capital New Delhi switched schools to online classes Monday until further notice as worsening toxic smog surged past 60 times the World Health Organization's recommended daily maximum.

Title: Military coup unlikely in protest of 3rd hereditary power transfe...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is attempting to extend his hereditary power into a fourth generation, but a military coup over the matter is unlikely, a former North Korean diplomat said Monday.

Title: Seoul offers to play key role in possible talks between Washingto...
Description: South Korea believes the chances of Pyongyang and Washington resuming dialogue without Seoul’s involvement under a second Trump administration are low, given the strengthened South Korea-U.S. alliance and the significant changes in the geopolitical landscape since Donald Trump’s first presidency, the government said, Monday.

Title: Defense posture against NK threats bolstered under Yoon administr...
Description: South Korea's military has significantly bolstered its defense posture against North Korea's nuclear and missile threats during the incumbent administration, the defense ministry said Monday, citing an increase in the deployment of U.S. strategic assets and field training exercises.

Title: New Nvidia AI chips overheating in servers, the Information repor...
Description: Nvidia's new Blackwell AI chips, which have already faced delays, have encountered problems with accompanying servers that overheat, causing some customers to worry they will not have enough time to get new data centers up and running, the Information reported on Sunday.

Title: McDonald's feast undercuts Trump health pledge
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump's pick for health secretary, Robert F. Kennedy Jr., has been pictured sharing a McDonald's meal with his future boss, days after they promised to 'make America healthy again.'

Title: S. Korea reviews measures to reclaim loans to N. Korea over destr...
Description: The unification ministry said Monday it is reviewing measures to reclaim loans granted to North Korea for building inter-Korean roads and train tracks after the North blew them up in October.

Title: S. Korea says N. Korea is 'crossing line' with trash balloon camp...
Description: South Korea's military on Monday condemned North Korea for 'crossing the line' with its continued sending of trash-carrying balloons to the South and warned that all responsibility lies within the North.

Title: Biden allows Ukraine to use US arms to strike inside Russia
Description: President Joe Biden's administration has allowed Ukraine to use U.S. - made weapons to strike deep into Russia, two U.S. officials and a source familiar with the decision said on Sunday, in a significant reversal of Washington's policy in the Ukraine-Russia conflict.

Title: Trump taps Brendan Carr for chairman of the Federal Communication...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump will tap Brendan Carr as chairman of the Federal Communications Commission, he said in a statement on Sunday.

Title: N. Korea launches trash balloons toward S. Korea
Description: North Korea sent what appear to be balloons carrying trash toward South Korea on Monday, the military here said, resuming its balloon campaign after about a three-week hiatus.

Title: N. Korea's Kim calls for bolstering nuclear forces 'without limit...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has called for bolstering the country's nuclear forces 'without limitation' and completing war preparations as the country's enemies have increased 'frantic' military confrontations with North Korea, state media reported Monday.

Title: Hezbollah spokesman killed in rare Israeli strike on central Beir...
Description: The main spokesman for Lebanon's Hezbollah militant group was killed in the first Israeli airstrike on central Beirut in more than a month on Sunday, an official with the militant group told The Associated Press.

Title: Saudi executes more than 100 foreigners in 2024: AFP tally
Description: Saudi Arabia has executed more than 100 foreigners this year, according to an AFP tally indicating a sharp increase which one rights group said was unprecedented.

Title: Super Typhoon Man-yi batters Philippines' most populous island
Description: Super Typhoon Man-yi slammed into the Philippines' most populous island on Sunday, with the national weather service warning of flooding, landslides and huge waves as the storm sweeps across the archipelago nation.

Title: Russian exiled opposition to stage major anti-war protest
Description: The Russian opposition, forced into exile and weakened by internal conflicts, will organize its first major demonstration against Moscow's Ukraine invasion in Berlin on Sunday, testing its political credibility in the third year of the war.

Title: World looks to G20 in Rio for breakthrough in climate talks
Description: Diplomatic tensions over global warming will take center stage at the G20 summit in Brazil this week, as negotiators at U.N. talks in Azerbaijan hit an impasse on climate finance that they hope leaders of the world's 20 major economies can break.

Title: Zelenskyy says Russia launched 120 missiles, 90 drones targeting ...
Description: Russia on Sunday launched a massive drone and missile attack on Ukraine, described by officials as the largest over the past months, targeting energy infrastructure and killing civilians.

Title: 8 killed in 2nd mass attack in China in a week
Description: A former student went on a stabbing rampage at a vocational college in eastern China, killing eight people and injuring 17, police said on Sunday, just days after the deadliest attack in the country in a decade.

Title: Japan's Mount Fuji eyes China-made tram to transport hikers, sour...
Description: Japanese authorities seeking to reduce the carbon footprint and overcrowding at Mount Fuji will propose a trackless, rubber- tired tram system made by China's CRRC to transport climbers, a person with direct knowledge of the plan said.

Title: Olympic champ Zheng, Hong Kong's Haughey on strength, sacrifice a...
Description: It is not often three Olympic gold medalists and Hong Kong's greatest athlete are gathered in a room together to discuss mental strength, sacrifice and what it takes to win, so when the opportunity arises you listen.

Title: Trump in New York for UFC fight at Madison Square Garden
Description: President-elect Donald Trump celebrated his election victory on Saturday night by attending an Ultimate Fighting Championship event with billionaire friend Elon Musk and cheering fans at a heavily guarded Madison Square Garden in New York City. Known by some in the mixed martial arts world as the 'Combatant in Chief,' Trump counts UFC President Dana White as a close friend and considers fans of the sport part of his political base. Trump sat between White and Musk and paid rapt attention to the fights.

Title: Trump taps fracking magnate and climate skeptic as energy chief
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump nominated fracking magnate and climate change skeptic Chris Wright as energy secretary on Saturday, tasking him with 'cutting red tape' which the new administration hopes will drive investment in fossil fuels.

Title: NK leader's sister says Seoul will have to pay 'dear price' for l...
Description: The powerful sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un said Sunday that South Korea will have to pay a 'dear price' for sending propaganda leaflets across the border the previous day.

Title: N. Korea's GPS jamming continues for 10th day
Description: North Korea's jamming of GPS signals across the border with South Korea continued Sunday for the 10th consecutive day, the military said.

Title: Xi vows to work with Trump team as he meets Biden in Peru
Description: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Saturday vowed to work with the incoming U.S. administration of President-elect Donald Trump as he held his final talks with outgoing President Joe Biden on key conflicts from cyber crime to trade, Taiwan and Russia.

Title: NK troops in Ukraine war 'extremely significant' for east Asia se...
Description: Japan's foreign minister warned Saturday that North Korean troops entering the Ukraine conflict would have an 'extremely significant' effect on east Asian security.

Title: Fire engulfs hospital ward in northern India, killing 10 newborn ...
Description: A fire tore through a neonatal intensive care unit in a hospital in northern India, killing 10 newborn babies and injuring 16 others, authorities said.

Title: Russia pumps gas via Ukraine but volumes to Austria cut
Description: Russian gas giant Gazprom continued to pump steady volumes of gas to Europe via Ukraine on Saturday, but supplies to Austrian energy company OMV were halted hours after Vienna said Russia had given notice it would cut off flows.

Title: APEC leaders hold Lima summit as Trump prepares to return to offi...
Description: Leaders of Pacific Rim countries including the U.S. and China gathered Friday in Peru for an Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation meeting, the first major global summit since U.S. President-elect Donald Trump’s election victory.

Title: Archegos' Bill Hwang deserves 21 years in prison, US says
Description: Bill Hwang, the founder of Archegos Capital Management, should spend 21 years in prison for running a market manipulation scheme that wiped out his $36 billion firm and cost its lenders more than $10 billion, federal prosecutors said on Friday.

Title: US to deter nuclear threats from N. Korea, China, Russia 'simulta...
Description: An updated U.S. nuclear employment strategy calls for the United States to be able to deter threats from North Korea, China and Russia 'simultaneously' during peacetime, a crisis and in conflict, a Pentagon report showed Friday.

Title: Trump names Karoline Leavitt as youngest ever White House press s...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump on Friday named Karoline Leavitt, his campaign press secretary, to serve as his White House press secretary.

Title: Poland moves to reopen embassy in N. Korea closed during COVID-19...
Description: Poland said Friday it is reactivating its embassy in North Korea’s capital to become the second Western nation after Sweden to resume operations that were suspended due to Pyongyang's tight COVID-19 restrictions.

Title: N. Korea's GPS jamming expands to wider regions along inter-Korea...

Title: US to deter nuclear threats from N. Korea, China, Russia 'simulta...
Description: An updated U.S. nuclear employment strategy calls for the United States to be able to deter threats from North Korea, China and Russia 'simultaneously' during peacetime, a crisis and in conflict, a Pentagon report showed Friday.

Title: China's October data shows soft economic underbelly, Trump threat...
Description: China's factory output growth slowed in October and it was still too early to call a turn in the crisis-hit property sector even though consumers perked up, keeping alive calls for Beijing to top-up its recent blitz of stimulus to revitalize the economy.

Title: US finalizes $6.6 billion chips award for TSMC ahead of Trump ret...
Description: The U.S. Commerce Department said Friday it has finalized a $6.6 billion government subsidy for Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing's U.S. unit for semiconductor production in Phoenix, Arizona.

Title: N. Korean leader 'sensitive' to int'l human rights pressure: ex-N...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is very 'sensitive' to international pressure over his country's human rights situation because he knows suppressing the issue is crucial to retaining his hereditary power, a former North Korean diplomat said Friday.

Title: US may have difficulty in proposing talks to NK amid enhanced thr...
Description: The United States may have difficulty in proposing dialogue to North Korea, given the North's advanced nuclear capabilities and security concerns raised by its troop deployment to Russia, a senior Seoul official said Friday.

Title: Ex-Trump envoy on N. Korea says Kim Jong-un won't negotiate denuc...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un won't negotiate denuclearization with the United States, as he has more powerful weapons and support from Russia, Joseph Yun, a former U.S. envoy on North Korea policy, said Friday, dismissing any chances for dialogue as a 'non-starter.'

Title: Trump team's 'America First' policy shouldn't mean 'America only'...
Description: Korean American Sen.-elect Andy Kim stressed the need Thursday to make sure that President-elect Donald Trump's 'America First' policy does not mean 'America only,' as he expressed concerns over some of Trump's personnel choices.

Title: Trump chooses anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. as heal...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump announced Thursday he will nominate anti-vaccine activist Robert F. Kennedy Jr. to lead the Department of Health and Human Services, putting a man whose views public health officials have decried as dangerous in charge of a massive agency that oversees everything from drug, vaccine and food safety to medical research, Medicare and Medicaid.

Title: Fed will likely cut rates cautiously given persistent inflation p...
Description: Chair Jerome Powell said Thursday that the Federal Reserve will likely cut its key interest rate slowly and deliberately in the coming months, in part because inflation has shown signs of persistence and the Fed's officials want to see where it heads next.

Title: China's president unveils a megaport in Peru, but locals say they...
Description: On the edge of Peru’s coastal desert, a remote fishing town where a third of all residents have no running water is being transformed into a huge deep-water port to cash in on the inexorable rise of Chinese interest in resource-rich South America.

Title: Trump's transition team aims to kill Biden EV tax credit

Title: N. Korea's Kim orders mass production of suicide attack drones: K...
Description: North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has overseen the performance test of suicide attack drones, and stressed the need for prompt full-scale mass production, the North's state media reported Friday.

Title: Will Trump revive his bromance with Kim Jong-un?
Description: As U.S. President-elect Donald Trump prepares for his second term, uncertainties loom over the Korean Peninsula, already fraught with North Korea's nuclear threats. South Koreans are increasingly anxious about the potential return of Trump’s unpredictable diplomatic approach.

Title: Two climate activists charged with spraying paint on UK's Stonehe...
Description: Two environmental protesters who sprayed paint on Britain's Stonehenge in June have been charged with offences related to the alleged damage caused to the prehistoric megalithic monument, prosecutors said on Thursday.

Title: Russia open to any Ukraine peace talks if Trump starts them: envo...
Description: Russia is open to negotiations on an end to the Ukraine war if initiated by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump, but any talks need to be based on the realities of Russian advances, Moscow's ambassador to the U.N. in Geneva told reporters on Thursday.

Title: [EXCLUSIVE] 'Don't die for Putin': Rights groups to send message ...
Description: Human rights groups in South Korea will issue a joint open letter urging North Korean troops deployed in Russia not to sacrifice their lives for Moscow’s war efforts against Ukraine, said an activist familiar with the matter.

Title: Donald Trump's China policy could pit deal makers against ideolog...
Description: Throughout his winning campaign, U.S. President-elect Donald Trump pitched himself as a master dealmaker, vowing to secure the best economic terms for America and insisting that doing so would restore its global supremacy.

Title: Trump officially taps Florida Sen. Marco Rubio as secretary of st...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump officially nominated Florida Sen. Marco Rubio as his secretary of state on Wednesday, calling him a 'strong advocate for our nation' and a 'true friend to our allies.'

Title: Trump names former congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard as director of nat...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump tapped former congresswoman Tulsi Gabbard to serve as the director of national intelligence (DNI) on Wednesday, saying the military veteran will bring 'fearless' spirit to America's intelligence community.

Title: Biden, Trump meet in White House, call for smooth transition
Description: President Joe Biden and President-elect Donald Trump met at the White House on Wednesday for the first time since last week's presidential election, with both calling for a smooth transition of power.

Title: Another Korean American wins seat in US Congress
Description: Another Korean American won a seat in the U.S. House of Representatives, a news report said Wednesday, an election that will add to a steadily growing list of Korean American lawmakers in Congress.

Title: China nominates vice UN representative as ambassador to S. Korea:...
Description: China's Deputy Permanent Representative to the United Nations Dai Bing has been nominated as the country's new ambassador to South Korea, diplomatic sources said Wednesday.

Title: Philippines says it will cooperate if ICC seeks Duterte's custody...
Description: The Philippine government said Wednesday its law enforcement agencies will be bound to cooperate if the International Criminal Court seeks the custody of former President Rodrigo Duterte as part of an investigation into thousands of deaths during his crackdown on illegal drugs.

Title: Delhi's pollution turns 'severe' as temperatures, wind speeds dro...
Description: Air pollution in India's national capital increased to 'severe' on an official index on Wednesday for the first time this season as temperatures and wind speeds dropped, reducing visibility and affecting some flights.

Title: China clears memorial to mass killing victims as government scram...
Description: Authorities in the southern Chinese city of Zhuhai removed wreaths, candles and bottles of Chinese alcohol, offerings laid at the scene of the deadliest mass killing in the country in a decade, as the government scrambled to respond and censor the outrage online. On Monday, a male driver angry at his divorce settlement rammed his car into a crowd at a sports center in the city of 2.5 million, killing 35 people and injuring 43, but the government took almost a day to announce the death toll.

Title: Why are countries fighting over climate finance at COP29?
Description: The main task for nearly 200 countries at the U.N.'s COP29 climate summit is to broker a deal that ensures up to trillions of dollars in financing for climate projects worldwide.

Title: N. Korea deployment in Ukraine fight demands 'firm response': Bli...
Description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken warned Wednesday that the deployment of North Korean troops alongside Russian forces fighting on the Ukrainian border demanded a 'firm response.'

Title: Japan's rising wholesale inflation heightens uncertainty on BOJ's...
Description: Japan's wholesale inflation accelerated in October at the fastest annual pace in more than a year as renewed yen falls pushed up import costs for some goods, complicating the central bank's decision on how soon to raise interest rates.

Title: Trump's Rubio and Waltz picks signal 'existential' fight with Chi...
Description: In leaning on hawks Marco Rubio and Mike Waltz, Donald Trump is setting the stage for an existential battle against China - although, as always, the president-elect's knack for dealmaking may intervene.

Title: Trump picks John Ratcliffe to be CIA director
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Tuesday he had picked former Director of National Intelligence (DNI) John Ratcliffe to serve as director of the Central Intelligence Agency.

Title: Trump taps Fox News host Pete Hegseth as defense secretary
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Tuesday nominated military veteran and Fox News host Pete Hegseth to serve as defense secretary when the Republican takes back the White House in January.

Title: Trump says Elon Musk, Vivek Ramaswamy will lead Dept. of Governme...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Tuesday Elon Musk and former Republican presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy will lead the Department of Government Efficiency.

Title: Trump officially names Rep. Mike Waltz as his national security a...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump officially named Florida Rep. Mike Waltz as his national security advisor on Tuesday, saying the Green Beret veteran will be a 'tremendous' champion of his incoming administration's pursuit of 'peace through strength.'

Title: US confirms N. Korean troops have begun engaging in combat operat...
Description: The United States confirmed Tuesday that North Korean troops, who have been deployed to Russia's western front-line Kursk region, have begun engaging in combat operations against Ukrainian forces.

Title: Trump's Day One: Deportations, border wall, scrapping Biden human...
Description: President-elect Donald Trump is expected to take a slew of executive actions on his first day in the White House to ramp up immigration enforcement and roll back President Joe Biden’s flagship legal entry programs, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.

Title: Britain's Queen Camilla returns to public duties after chest infe...
Description: Britain’s Queen Camilla is set to return to public duties Tuesday after missing weekend events commemorating the nation’s war dead because she was recovering from a chest infection.

Title: Awareness of human rights growing inside N. Korea thanks to int'l...
Description: International attention to North Korea's human rights abuses has had a perceptible effect in raising awareness of human rights among the country's general public, a former North Korean diplomat said Tuesday, calling for sustained global efforts on the issue.

Title: Kim Jong-un sees UN criticism of Pyongyang's human rights situati...
Description: According to documents obtained by the Ministry of Unification, North Korean leader Kim Jong-un was broadly involved in directing the country's response to international criticism of its human rights situation, viewing it as a threat to his regime.

Title: Japan PM Ishiba survives parliament vote as Trump looms large
Description: Japanese lawmakers voted for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba to stay on as leader on Monday, after his scandal-tarnished coalition lost its parliamentary majority in a lower house election last month.

Title: Trump likely to appoint US Senator Marco Rubio as top US diplomat...
Description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump is expected to appoint U.S. Senator Marco Rubio as his first secretary of state under his second term, news reports have said.
